2025-01-23.title: Last 24 Hours to Register to Join the Liwa Desert Trip!
2025-01-23.description: Don't miss out on one of the most popular trips of the year! The Kashtah program is back, and spots fill up fast.Join us for an unforgettable service-learning experience in the Liwa desert!"Kashtah" means a day trip in pleasant weather, and this excursion will immerse you in the UAE’s intangible heritage. You’ll engage with local culture, connect with people, and explore Liwa desert’s unique beauty.Dates: January 25 or 26, 2025Transportation and food are provided.Clickhereto learn more about this desert experience and to register before spots run out!Not a first-year student, but want to chaperone? Contact the Civic Engagement and Service team atnyuad.civic.engagement@nyu.edu.

2025-01-23.title: TODAY | Panel Discussion with the HRF Winter Writing Retreat Participants
2025-01-23.description: JAN 23 | 5 PM | Reading Room, A4-008 |RSVP HEREThe Humanities Research Fellowship for the Study of the Arab World invites you to apanel discussionshowcasing the work of our inauguralWinter Writing Retreatparticipants. This event will feature research from eight senior scholars representing institutions in Germany, Austria, the UK, and the US.Spanning fields such as Anthropology, Cultural Studies, History, Literature, and Middle Eastern Studies, their projects delve into innovative dimensions in the study of the Arab world. This panel offers a unique opportunity to engage with cutting-edge Humanities research and connect with global scholars.SpeakersJames Allinson(University of Edinburgh)Sebastian Günther(University of Goettingen)Magdalena Moorthy-Kloss(Leibniz-ZMO / Austrian Academy of Sciences)Mohammed Muharram(University of Bremen)Mona Oraby(Howard University)Vaughn Rasberry(Stanford)Zekeria Ahmed Salem(Northwestern University)Nükhet Varlik(Rutgers University – Newark)

2025-01-22.title: Cultivating Psychological Safety at Work-A Path to Inclusion and Innovation-Thurs at 6pm Online
2025-01-22.description: TheEngineering IDBEA Committeepresents the first talk this year of it's seminar series, "Cultivating Psychological Safety at Work-A Path to Inclusion and Innovation"Date: Thursday January 23, 2025Time: 6pmOnline. Zoom link:https://nyu.zoom.us/j/97779534756Join us for this session with Vandana Juneja, Equity, Diversity & Inclusion Officer at Thornton Tomasetti. Vandana will lead us through a discussion on cultivating psychological safety at work - understanding the meaning of psychological safety, its importance as a business imperative - particularly in a technical environment, pragmatic actions for cultivating a psychologically safe culture on teams and in organizations, and how we can all draw on empathy to supercharge workplace cultures for improved communication, collaboration, and innovation.

2025-01-22.title: Volunteer at Kayan Wellness Festival: The largest wellness festival in the region
2025-01-22.description: Kayan Wellness Festival is a three-day event set against the scenic backdrop of Al Fahid Island's beaches. The festival is a transformative experience designed to inspire holistic well-being across mind, body, soul, and heartAs a volunteer at the Kayan Wellness Festival, you will (duties vary by role):Ensure the smooth execution of this transformative eventWelcome guests at the entranceAssist with navigation and session support as a Guest LiaisonWork closely with performers and facilitators in zones like The Soul Zone, The Body Zone, and The Heart ZoneGuide talent between green rooms and session spacesAssist with light equipment handlingHelp monitor areas like the Biohacking Pavilion or the Kids HideoutEach role requires excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and the ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment.For more information and to registerclick here.

2025-01-22.title: Calling all Artists and Creatives!
2025-01-22.description: Interested in a career in the arts? Looking for ways to build your portfolio, CV, and cover letter as an aspiring artist/ arts professional?Sign up for theArts Proxy Program, an 8-week-long professional development program for students interested in a career in the arts. It aims to provide participants a well-rounded introduction to the field, its structure, the skills needed, and alumni’s experiences.﻿Over the course of the program, you will develop and refine your resumes and artistic portfolio; attend hard and soft skill-building workshops (e.g. mock interview, putting together a residency/grant application, budgeting); learn about opportunities available to creatives; connect with artists, curators, and art programmers in the UAE; and complete a creative project of your choice.Start Date: Week of February 10, 2025Expected Hours: 3-5 hours/week, for 8 weeksApplyhere

2025-01-21.title: Cybersecurity Scam of the Week: PayPal Invoice Scam
2025-01-21.description: Cybercriminals have developed a new way to exploit PayPal users through phishing scams. A legitimate-looking email from PayPal requests payment and contains a real PayPal link. Despite appearing authentic, this email is part of a malicious trick.The email is sent to your address and an unrecognized one belonging to cybercriminals. Clicking the link in the email links their address to your PayPal account, granting them full access to your account details, credentials, and financial information.Tips to Protect Yourself:Avoid making payments after receiving unexpected emails. Instead, visit the organization’s official website or app to ensure secure payments.Carefully check email recipients. Be cautious of emails sent to unfamiliar addresses.Even trusted domains can be used maliciously. Always verify emails, even if they appear legitimate.Stay vigilant and secure your accounts!

2025-01-20.title: ITC - Transportation Innovation Exhibition 2025
2025-01-20.description: The Integrated Transport Centre (ITC) is pleased to announce the annual Transportation Innovation Exhibition for 2025, scheduled to take place in February at their Headquarters in the Rabdan Area of Abu Dhabi City. This exhibition will highlight pioneering technologies, innovations, trials, and research papers related to the transport sector or impacting transportation systems.The event will be held from the18th to the 19th of February 2025. Specific timings and additional details will be confirmed at a later stage.We invite NYUAD staff, researchers, professors, or students who may wish to present their work during the exhibition to submit theattached templatetonyuad.cities@nyu.eduby the end of this week.The audience for this event will primarily consist of ITC employees, experts from relevant transport companies' R&D divisions, as well as academic researchers.

2025-01-20.title: The RealAD Show 2025 Auditions are now open!
2025-01-20.description: The RealAD Show 2025is back and now open for auditions! This NYUAD tradition is an annual theater production for first-year students - written and performed by upper-class NYU Abu Dhabi students - to present some of the real life student experiences and support available.If you are interested in exploring your talents through dance, music, comedy, and drama,click hereto learn more about how to be a Cast Member. (no formal experience required)Being part of RealAD is a once in a lifetime experience! Please note this is a funded opportunity that will require you to be in New York City this summer for rehearsals. Participants will receive 1-credit for their participation.Deadline for submissions is January 27, 2025.

2025-01-17.title: Aviation Safety Course | Selected Topics in Mechanical Engineering
2025-01-17.description: UPDATED January 17ENGR-UH 4760 - Aviation SafetyTuesday & Thursdays3:35 to 6:15 PMJoinMarwa Al Mamari, UAE's first Aerospace Engineer, in exploring the principles that keep the skies safe. This 4-credit course covers key topics like human factors, risk management, safety technologies, and global safety initiatives.You’ll dive into case studies of major aviation accidents, uncovering root causes and lessons learned. Understand the regulatory frameworks that shape global aviation safety, and gain insights into cutting-edge tools and systems keeping aircraft secure.Why choose this course?Engage in hands-on projects and real-world case studies.Learn from guest speakers who are leaders in aviation safety.Gain practical skills to identify and manage risks.Prepare to lead in both aviation safety and related fields.Whether you’re passionate about aerospace, human factors, or safety tech, this course equips you with the knowledge and skills for a successful career.Register now on Albert!

2025-01-17.title: Important: End of January Term 2025 Departure Shuttle Schedule From Campus to Airport
2025-01-17.description: TheEnd of January Term 2025 Departure Shuttles from Campus to Airportis now live on the student portal. Please confirm your flight time and departure terminal from your ticket and ensure you take theshuttle most appropriately timed to your departure. Always allow sufficient time to reach the airport.Students departing Abu Dhabi must leave campus at least 4 hours before their flight.Students departing Dubai must leave campus at least 6 hours before their flight.The shuttles are provided on a first-come, first-served basis and will depart promptly from the Welcome Center, so it is important to be mindful of departure times. If you miss a scheduled shuttle, you must take a taxi to the airport to avoid missing your flight.In case of any issue regarding your shuttle, please contact Nirvana Travel at the following contact details: Tel: +971 2 628 7250 Email:nyuad@ntravel.aeSafe Travels!Student Mobility Team.

2025-01-17.title: Important: Spring 2025 Arrival shuttle schedule from the Airport to Campus
2025-01-17.description: TheSpring 2025 Arrival shuttle schedule from the Airport to Campusis now live on the student portal. Please confirm your specific arrival time from your plane ticket and plan to take the shuttle closest to your arrival time.Once you exit the secured airport area and enter the arrivals lounge, look for the Nirvana Travel Coordinator with NYUAD signage. They will escort you to the vehicle that will transport you to campus. All vehicles will depart promptly from the airport, so it is important to be mindful of departure times.Airport transfers are available on a first-come, first-served basis, with priority given to students whose flights align with the official check-in period. If you miss a scheduled vehicle, you may wait for the next scheduled vehicle (if available) or take your own taxi to campus at your expense. Students arriving outside the arrival window period must arrange their own transportation to campus.In case of any issue regarding your shuttle, please contact Nirvana Travel at the following contact details: Tel: +971 2 628 7250 Email:nyuad@ntravel.aeIf you have any travel-related questions or concerns, please feel free to contact our team atnyuad@studentmobility@nyu.edu.

2025-01-16.title: All are invited to participate in MRI research!
2025-01-16.description: ASPIRE Precision Medicine Research Institute Abu Dhabi invites you to participate in a MRI study here at NYUAD. The institute’s mission is to gain a better understanding of conditions prevalent in the region.For the first session, we will first collect demographic data and vision tests. Then, we will collect a series of brain scans in the MRI scanner. Finally, we will collect a saliva sample. This will take approximately 2 hours to complete. The second session will consist of a 1 hour OCT scan and VR vision tests. You will be compensated with vouchers worth approximately 180 AED for full participation.You are eligible to participate if you are above 18 years of age, do not have a history of neurological conditions, and are not pregnant at the time of the study. Those with non-removable metal in their body cannot participate.If you are interested please email the researchers below with the subject line “MRI study.”Last names A-M contact Aysha Hamkari:aah698@nyu.eduLast names N-Z contact Dana Alkalali:dna8993@nyu.edu

2025-01-16.title: Join Us for Friday Meal Distribution with Emirates Red Crescent!
2025-01-16.description: We’re thrilled to announce an incredible opportunity to make a meaningful impact by distributing meals to those in need. Join us every Friday morning from 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM in Mussafah, in front of the Emirates Red Crescent Warehouse, as we work together to support our community.Event Details:Location: Mussafah, in front of ERC WarehouseTiming: Fridays, 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM (before Friday prayers)Transportation: Provided for all participantsRegister here!Be a part of this rewarding experience, and let’s make a difference together! For any questions, please reach out to NYUAD Civic Engagement & Service at nyuad.civic.engagement@nyu.edu.Starts on January 24, 2025!

2025-01-16.title: Exciting Announcement: Rabt Hub Program is Here!
2025-01-16.description: We’re thrilled to announce the launch ofRabt Hub, an inspiring initiative by NYUAD in collaboration with the Emirates Foundation and the Emirates Council for Rural Development. Rabt Hub aims to empower young women aged 18–35 by enhancing their English language skills for practical, everyday use and personal development.Be part of this impactful journey!As a tutor, you’ll play a key role in helping participants achieve their goals, while gaining valuable experience in mentorship and cross-cultural exchange.Interested in joining? Register now![Registration Link]For any inquiries, please email nyuad.civic.engagement@nyu.edu.Let’s make a difference together!

2025-01-13.title: Graduating in Spring? Check your DPR now
2025-01-13.description: UPDATED January 13Please check your online Degree Progress Report (DPR) in Albert to ensure all requirements are either "Satisfied" or "In-progress" as this is the system used to confirm yourgraduation eligibility. If any items show as "Not Satisfied" it means action is required to resolve an issue.If you have any questions or concerns, or if adjustments to your DPR are needed, your major-mentor or theAcademic Resource Center(ARC) in the Library may be able to provide guidance and/or submit requests.Note: Adjustments toward Core Requirements must be submitted by the Core Curriculum (nyuad.core@nyu.edu)YourGraduation Statusalso appears near the top of your DPR – if it still shows “Applied for Graduation” that means we have not yet verified your degree audit/review so you should plan to check back on that later.Separate communications will go out to Summer expected grads later in the academic year.

2025-01-13.title: Diploma Information for Fall 2024 and January 2025
2025-01-13.description: UPDATED January 13When will I receive my diploma?For more detailed information regarding graduation and diplomas, please visit theNYUAD Graduation, Diplomas, and Commencementinfo page:https://students.nyuad.nyu.edu/academics/registration/graduation-requirements/graduation-diplomas-and-commencement/Physical diplomas are expected to be ready for distribution mid-March.CeDiplomas will be ordered approximately Feb 15th, and are usually available within 2 weeks.!Diplomas cannot be released if any diploma hold exists on your student records, please check Albert to resolve these ahead of time.Official transcripts requested after degrees are conferred in Albert will show degrees awarded along with the Fall/Jan conferral date (January 27, 2025) and degree GPA. For undergraduates, degree GPA does NOT include first year grades.

2025-01-10.title: Bookstore Booksigning - From Rags to Riches
2025-01-10.description: Join us for an exciting book signing event featuringMohammed Al Fahim, the author of the inspiring bookFrom Rags to Riches: A Story of Abu DhabiEvent Details:Date:January 30, 2025Time:4:30 PM - 5:30 PMLocation:A6 Room 007 / Lecture HallDon’t miss the opportunity to meet the author, learn more about his incredible journey, and get your copy ofFrom Rags to Richessigned!Spaces are limited, so be sure to register your interesthereWe look forward to seeing you there!

2025-01-10.title: The Zayed Award for Human Fraternity Week
2025-01-10.description: The Zayed Award for Human Fraternity Week is looking for volunteers to support their event by welcoming and guiding guests such as prominent international figures and global leaders, and contribute to enriching understanding of the UAE's leading role in promoting the values of human fraternity and peace around the worldFor more information and to registerclick here.About the Zayed Award for Human FraternityThe Zayed Award for Human Fraternity is an annual independent global award that recognizes, supports and honors people and entities of all backgrounds working to advance the timeless values of solidarity, integrity, fairness and optimism.

2025-01-10.title: Panel Discussion with HRF Winter Writing Retreat Participants
2025-01-10.description: JAN 23 | 5 PM | Reading Room, A4-008 |RSVP HEREThe Humanities Research Fellowship for the Study of the Arab World invites you to apanel discussionshowcasing the work of our inauguralWinter Writing Retreatparticipants. This event will feature research from eight senior scholars representing institutions in Germany, Austria, the UK, and the US.Spanning fields such as Anthropology, Cultural Studies, History, Literature, and Middle Eastern Studies, their projects delve into innovative dimensions in the study of the Arab world. This panel offers a unique opportunity to engage with cutting-edge Humanities research and connect with global scholars.SpeakersJames Allinson(University of Edinburgh)Zekeria Denna(Northwestern University)Sebastian Günther(University of Goettingen)Magdalena Moorthy-Kloss(Leibniz-ZMO / Austrian Academy of Sciences)Mohammed Muharram(University of Bremen)Mona Oraby(Howard University)Vaughn Rasberry II(Stanford)Nükhet Varlik(Rutgers University – Newark)

2025-01-09.title: Spring 2025 Registration Information
2025-01-09.description: Reminder: Spring 2025 class start onTuesday, January 21- finalize your schedule today!Didn't complete a prerequisite course in time for the spring semester? Update your schedule so you have the correct courses!Update your edit/swaps and waitlists so you don't get switched into a course you may no longer need.The last day to add/drop first seven-week courses isMonday, January 27 by 4:00pm. Please keep in mind that some classes are restricted from being added during the second week of the semester - so don't wait! Get your year started off right be completing your schedule changes today! The add/drop deadline at Global Sites may have a different deadline - if you are studying away this semester, please keep in mind that other campuses can have different deadlines.If you have any questions about course planning and your major requirements reach out to the ARC (nyuad.arc@nyu.edu) and/or your mentor.All academic deadlines can be foundhere.Have a wonderful spring semester at NYUAD!

2025-01-08.title: UAE Plant and Environment Society Seminars (UPES)
2025-01-08.description: UAE Plant and Environment Society Seminars (UPES)Speaker Name: Professor Ali Al-Keblawy, University of SharjahTitle: Using UAE Native Plants for Sustainable Landscapes, Desert Restoration, and Green InnovationsHost: UAE Plant and Environment Society (UPES)Location: Zoom (link)Time: 4 pm- 5 pm (UAE time)Date: Wednesday, January 22nd, 2025Abstract: This seminar highlights the potential of native plants in achieving sustainable cityscapes, rehabilitating degraded deserts, and advancing agriculture in arid regions of the UAE. Key topics include the use of native plants in sustainable landscaping of the cities, the role ofMoringa peregrinain biodiesel production and urban landscaping,Citrullus colocynthisas a desert-adapted crop for biodiesel and pharmaceutical production, andCyperus conglomeratusfor oil production and sand dune stabilization. The discussion will showcase how these species contribute to environmental sustainability, economic development, and ecosystem restoration, offering innovative solutions for arid land management.Please sign uphereto receive updates about UPES events.

2025-01-06.title: PHRC: UAE HEALTHY FUTURE STUDY. JOIN US
2025-01-06.description: Are you an Emirati above 18 years old ?The UAE Healthy Future study is the first prospective study to provide scientific evidence of the causes of chronic diseases in the United Arab Emirates. The study also plays an important role in the development of prevention methods for the benefit of the UAE and Arab societies.This study will help us find out:Why obesity, diabetes, and heart disease common in the UAE?What are the most important causes of these diseases?What is the relative importance of our genes, lifestyle (including diet, physical activity, and tobacco use) and the environment?What can we do to prevent them?BOOK YOUR APPOINTMENT NOWhttps://uaehealthyfuture.timetap.com/#/JOIN USWellness Center C2, W014 & W015

2025-01-06.title: You are invited to participate in MRI research!
2025-01-06.description: ASPIRE Precision Medicine Research Institute Abu Dhabi invites you to participate in a MRI study here at NYUAD. The institute’s mission is to gain a better understanding of conditions prevalent in the region.We will first collect demographic data and vision tests. Then, we will collect a series of brain scans in the MRI scanner. Finally, we will collect a saliva sample. The study will take approximately 2 hours to complete. You will be compensated with vouchers worth approximately 120 AED for participation.You are eligible to participate if you are above 18 years of age, do not have a history of neurological conditions, and are not pregnant at the time of the study. Those with non-removable metal in their body cannot participate.If you are interested please email the researchers below with the subject line “MRI study.”Last names A-M contact Aysha Hamkari:aah698@nyu.eduLast names N-Z contact Dana Alkalali:dna8993@nyu.edu

2025-01-06.title: CGSB XIII Symposium February 19-21, 2025
2025-01-06.description: Get the word out!The Center for Genomics and Systems Biology, in collaboration with NYUAD Institute, will host the thirteenth annual Genomics and Systems Biology Symposium on February 19-21, 2025.Discover how AI and machine learning tools transform the ability to analyze large datasets, uncovering hidden patterns in basic and clinical research. With genomic research projected to generate up to four exabytes of data in the next decade, AI is becoming essential. Join CGSB XIII and explore its applications in biomedicine and functional and evolutionary genomics.Registration is now openhere.Submit your poster abstract by January 6, 2025, for a chance to win the Best Poster Award!
